medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive generalized itching skin eruption for 3 days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 3 days prior to admission and were progressive over this period. The patient had redness with mild local heat of the arteriovenous fistula noted about 2 months ago, which was aggravated by intravenous vancomycin administered weekly for 4 weeks. The skin eruption was resistant to oral and intravenous antihistamine therapy.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hepatitis B carrier, hypertension controlled by irbesartan and amlodipine for 4 years, end-stage IgA nephropathy on regular hemodialysis via arteriovenous fistula for 5 years.
medical_history.social_history: Patient was a Buddhist nun and had been on a vegetarian diet for more than 10 years.
